urls.context: Official Website Home Page, providing firm overview, AUM (~$600M), inception year, and high-level investment focus.
Official Team Page, listing all key personnel including Raja Kumar (Founder & CEO), Partners, and confirming Manjunath Kallapur (Director - Finance).
Official Portfolio Page, detailing key current investments (e.g., BigBasket, FreshToHome, ACKO) and successful exits, defining sector focus.
Official Fund/AIF Registration Page, listing formal fund names (Ascent Growth Trust, Ascent Private Equity Trust) and compliance details related to SEBI registration.
Official Investment Strategy Page, detailing the firm's approach, sector priorities (healthcare, pharma, technology), and typical mid-to-growth stage focus.
Fund Announcement news article confirming the closing size ($350M) and vintage year for the Ascent India Fund III.
Regulatory document (RHP for Newgen Software IPO) confirming Ascent India Fund III's specific investment and exit details via IPO.
External PitchBook profile providing structured data on funds, AUM, headquarters (Bengaluru), and deal flow history.
External Tracxn profile detailing portfolio company count (45+), team size (23 members), and investment stage focus.
Likely LinkedIn Profile for the contact, Manjunath Kallapur, confirming his role (Director - Finance) and prior professional experience at Deloitte.
SEC FORM ADV Filing (latest) for ASCENT CAPITAL ADVISORS INDIA PRIVATE LIMITED, providing legal regulatory status and jurisdiction details.
Official Contact Page listing office addresses in Bangalore (Headquarters) and Mumbai, along with general inquiry email.
Critical update on Ascent India Fund IV (or latest vehicle), confirming new Limited Partner commitment and $240 million (Rs 2,000 crore) fund target. (Oct 2024)
Primary source article confirming the final close of Ascent India Fund III at $350 million. Essential historical fund size data. (2010)
Business Standard report detailing the close of Ascent India Fund III at $350 million in late 2009/early 2010, confirming LP commitments.
Official press release confirming Ascent Capital's institutional equity investment of Rs 150 Crore (approx. $17M) in Daya General Hospital. (Sept 2025)
Legal report confirming Ascent India Fund III closing at USD 350 million, providing important regulatory context. (2010)
Critical news detailing the firm's structure change (Management Buyout from UTI AMC) and confirming key historical exits like Citrus Payments. (Nov 2016)
Reports on Ascent Capital commencing fundraising activities for its latest vehicle, targeting Rs 2,000 crore ($240 million). (Mar 2024)
VCCircle coverage of the recent Daya Group investment, detailing the expansion plans funded by the Ascent Capital PE investment. (Sept 2025)
Economic Times article confirming Ascent Capital led the $20 million funding round in corporate spend management startup EnKash. (Apr 2022)
News report indicating Ascent India Fund IV was nearing its final close target of $240 million, detailing fundraising progress. (2020)
Legal coverage of the Daya Hospital deal, providing secondary confirmation and mentioning the specific fund vehicle ('Ascent Growth Trust'). (Sept 2025)
Historical fund announcement (Fund IV planning stage) detailing initial target size ($350M-$400M) and confirming successful exit from KIMS. (2017)
Comprehensive investor database profile detailing recent investments (Daya Hospital, The Good Glamm Group) and providing a full portfolio overview.
PitchBook investor profile listing 48 total exits, latest investment (SeQuent Penems, Apr 2024), and detailed fund history and performance metrics.
Official website team page, confirming Manjunath Kallapur's designation as Director - Finance and listing current investment strategy and key portfolio companies (ACKO, BigBasket).
Economic Times article confirming Ascent Capital participated as an existing investor in robotics startup Haber's $38 million funding round. (July 2022)
Reports on Dune Packaging securing $12.08M from the related entity, Ascent Rift Valley Fund II, detailing expansion plans in East Africa. (May 2024)
Press release detailing Ascent Rift Valley Fund II's investment in Kenya's Dune Packaging, useful for understanding the broader Ascent brand activities. (May 2024)
